item.title: Lynda add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Lynda add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lynda add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lynda add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lynda add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lynda add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them. " -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Lynda add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am simply a 'book drunkard.' Books have the same irresistible temptation for me that liquor has for its devotee. I cannot withstand them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Lynda add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "There's such a lot of different Annes in me. I sometimes think that is why I'm such a troublesome person. If I was just the one Anne it would be ever so much more comfortable, but then it wouldn't be half so interesting." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Lynda add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Noble deeds and hot baths are the best cures for depression." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Lynda add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "When I read a book, I put in all the imagination I can, so that it is almost like writing the book as well as reading it - or rather, it is like living it. It makes reading so much more exciting, but I don't suppose many people try to do it." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Lynda add a quote by Carlos Ruiz Zafón
item.description: "Bea says that the art of reading is slowly dying, that it's an intimate ritual, that a book is a mirror that offers us only what we already carry inside us, that when we read, we do it with all our heart and mind, and great readers are becoming more scarce by the day." -- Carlos Ruiz Zafón

item.title: Lynda add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde
